name: Topics in Early Modern Art and Architecture
description: An in-depth examination of a topic in early modern (Renaissance and/or Baroque) art and/or architecture. Topics vary from year to year, and the content in any given year depends upon the instructor. A seminar course limited to 20 students. [24S]
prerequisites: FAH101H5/FAH105H5/FAH202H5 , FAH274H5/FAH279H5 and 1.0 in FAH/VCC at the 300/400 level
exclusions: None. Although equivalent courses are on the books at St. George it is highly unlikely that a topics course would have any significant overlap.
